pullRequest.title: Fix SHOW CREATE TABLE for Elastic Search

nodes.bodyText: Move to the bottom of this file
This commit needs to come after (or be squashed with) the one that fixes the bug
Add an explanation to the commit message describing why and what bug it fixes
Done. I added SchemaTableName to InternalTableMetatadata as you suggest but it is not used in the codebase. It is natural to be there though, and may come handy for object introspection.
Since this fixes code that was introduced in the previous commit, squash it with that commit.
This can be renamed to metadata for brevity.
This can be renamed to fields for brevity.

Inline these variables:
return new InternalTableMetadata(new SchemaTableName(schema, tableName), makeColumnMetadata(fields), makeColumnHandles(fields));
This can be renamed to metadata for brevity (and undo the rename below)

commit.message:
Remove fake properties from Elastic Search column metadata

Elastic Search connector exploited column properties map in
ColumnMetadata to store extra information needed for execution. Namely:
 - original colum name (not lower cased)
 - if column can be used for pushdown

Those were not registered in ColumnPropertyManager. That resulted in
failures when SHOW CREATE TABLE was executed for Elastic Search table.

We fix the issue by not storing extra properties in ColumnMetadata at
all. Instead we build Elatics Search ColumnHandle directly from Index
Metadata.
